raw_comment:
What do you notice?
Like many others I noticed that young people seem a lot more hopeful in terms of the future however more specifically people in what I imagine to be "developing countries" everyone is a lot more hopeful than the general first world countries where adults don't seem as hopeful. 

What do you wonder?
As a child we have grown up in the age of technology meaning we are surrounded by the media. In my experience this means being surrounded with statements about the world dying due to climate change or a political debate or the earth splitting into millions of pieces. However I have never felt threatened by this so I wonder why young adults are not loosing hope about our future. How are we not more influenced by the media into losing hope for the future?

How does this relate to you and your community?
Although Australia isn't on the graph I still find myself relating to the data. I think some older people in the community are loosing hope and going further perhaps"giving up". They are not going of be around for all of our future therefore it is not as relevant.
ace_sentences: I notice that many young people seem more hopeful about the future.
I imagine that many people in developing countries are more hopeful than many people in first-world countries.
I notice that many adults in first-world countries do not seem hopeful.
I grew up in the age of technology.
In my experience, the media contains statements about climate change.
In my experience, the media contains political debates.
In my experience, the media contains statements that the Earth will split into millions of pieces.
I have never felt threatened by these statements.
I wonder why many young adults do not lose hope about our future.
I wonder why the media does not influence many young adults to lose hope about the future.
Australia is not on the graph.
I still relate to the data.
I think that some older people in my community are losing hope.
I think that some older people in my community are giving up.
Many older people will not be alive for all of our future.
Therefore, the future is less relevant for many older people.
